revised_title: On Zoological Names and Homological Interpretations of Brain Structures
tldr: The author, W.H. Flower, responds to a paper by Prof. Owen about zoological names and homological interpretations of brain structures, specifically focusing on the connecting fibers of the brain. Flower discusses the differences in brain anatomy between Marsupialia and Monotremata, and other mammals, emphasizing the absence of a corpus callosum in the former. He also addresses criticisms of his previous abstract and clarifies his stance on the matter.
